Introduction to vsreport

UNECA

June 2024

introduction.Rmd

Introduction

vsreport is an R package designed to help with the creation of CRVS reports from record level data. It will produce tables in line with the best practice for CRVS reports.

Installation

You can install this development version from GitHub, you can use the devtools package:


# Install devtools if you don't already have it
install.packages(devtools)

# Install the vsreport from GitHub
devtools::install_github("tech-acs/vsreport")

Once installed, you can load the package using:

library(vsreport)

Usage

This should outline how someone can use the package to build a particular table or check what tables they can produce given the data they have.

Data Included in the Package

Ideally the package will have some test data that is synthetic so that people can see what the desired input data should look like as well as see how the validation checks take place as well as test outputs.

This test data should also serve as a good tool in order to test existing features or develop new ones.

Conclusion

A short bit on information on what the package can be used for.

Further Reading

Links to some of the material that shows how to implement this, such as the report_crvs codebase and the best practice documents for CRVS reports.
